const char * ivrRuntimeModeToString (ivr_runtime_mode mode)

Detailed Description

Contains all of the structs, enums, constants, and functions that are shared between the client and the server.

Data Structure Documentation

struct ivr_blob

A 2d integer vector.

Data Fields
uint32_t x The X coordinate of the blob.
uint32_t y The Y coordinate of the blob.
struct ivr_raw_packet

A packet returned by ivrClientGetRawPacket when the runtime is set to the IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_RAW mode.

Data Fields
ivr_vec3 a Calibrated accelerometer data.
ivr_vec3 g Calibrated gyroscope data.
ivr_vec3 m Calibrated magnetometer data.
uint8_t joybtn Controller button states. Supports up to 8 buttons.
uint8_t trig Controller trigger state. A value of 0 is fully pressed, 255 is fully released.
uint8_t joyx Controller joystick X component.
uint8_t joyy Controller joystick Y component.
uint32_t numBlobs The number of blobs found by the camera.
See also
ivr_blob
ivr_blob blobs[48] An array of up to 48 blobs. (hard memory limit currently is 53 unless size of shared memory buffer increases)
struct ivr_game_packet

A packet returned by ivrClientGetGamePacket when the runtime is set to the IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_GAME mode.

Data Fields
ivr_vec3 imu Fused sensor data representing orientation as Euler angles in degrees.
uint8_t joybtn Controller button states. Supports up to 8 buttons.
uint8_t trig Controller trigger state. A value of 0 is fully pressed, 255 is fully released.
uint8_t joyx Controller joystick X component.
uint8_t joyy Controller joystick Y component.
ivr_quat camRot An estimated orientation of the device based on camera data.
ivr_vec3 camPos An estimated position of the device based on camera data.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ivr_runtime_mode

All of the available modes that the runtime can operate in.

Enumerator
IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_GAME 

Standard output, containing data that's most useful for a game or other interactive application. Includes an estimated pose for the attached controller.

See also
ivr_game_packet
IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_CAPTURE 

Does not output anything but instead captures all controller data to a file for later playback.

IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_CALIBRATION 

Puts devices into calibration mode and outputs raw sensor data.

IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_RAW 

Outputs only raw sensor data. Meant for lower level applications that want to do more than just recieve a pose.

See also
ivr_raw_packet
IVR_RUNTIME_MODE_DEBUG 

Internal mode used to debug the runtime server.

enum ivr_runtime_options

All of the possible options for a runtime.

Enumerator
IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_GYRO 

Use the gyroscope on the device if possible.

IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_ACCEL 

Use the accelerometer on the device if possible.

IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_MAG 

Use the magnetometer on the device if possible.

IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_CONTROLS 

Read controls (triggers and buttons) if available.

IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_CAM 

Use an attached camera device for position tracking if available.

IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_CAM_ACCEL_FUSE 

Apply sensor fusion between camera and accelerometer data. Requires IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_ACCEL and IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_USE_CAM.

IVR_RUNTIME_OPT_DEFAULT 

The default set of options.

Function Documentation

const char* ivrRuntimeModeToString ( ivr_runtime_mode  mode)

Converts a value of ivr_runtime_mode to a string representation.

Parameters
[in]modeThe mode to convert to a string.
Returns
A string representing the mode if valid, otherwise NULL.
ivr_runtime_mode ivrRuntimeStringToMode ( const char *  mode)

Converts a string representation of ivr_runtime_mode back to the original value.

Parameters
[in]modeA string representing the mode.
Returns
THe original mode if the string is valid, otherwise, 0.
